remarks: Lemma for % ttgcont (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-May-2019.)
statement:
ttgval.n $e |- G = ( toTG ` H ) $.
ttgitvval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
ttgitvval.b $e |- P = ( Base ` H ) $.
ttgitvval.m $e |- .- = ( -g ` H ) $.
ttgitvval.s $e |- .x. = ( .s ` H ) $.
ttgelitv.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
ttgelitv.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
ttgbtwnid.r $e |- R = ( Base ` ( Scalar ` H ) ) $.
ttgbtwnid.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( 0 [,] 1 ) C_ R ) $.
ttgitvval.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` H ) $.
ttgcontlem1.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. CVec ) $.
ttgcontlem1.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
ttgcontlem1.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. P ) $.
ttgcontlem1.o $e |- ( ph -> M =/= 0 ) $.
ttgcontlem1.p $e |- ( ph -> K =/= 0 ) $.
ttgcontlem1.q $e |- ( ph -> K =/= 1 ) $.
ttgcontlem1.r $e |- ( ph -> L =/= M ) $.
ttgcontlem1.s $e |- ( ph -> L <_ ( M / K ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.l $e |- ( ph -> L e. ( 0 [,] 1 ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( 0 [,] 1 ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ( 0 [,] L ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.y $e |- ( ph -> ( X .- A ) = ( K .x. ( Y .- A ) ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.x $e |- ( ph -> ( X .- A ) = ( M .x. ( N .- A ) ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( A .+ ( L .x. ( N .- A ) ) ) ) $.
ttgcontlem1 $p |- ( ph -> B e. ( X I Y ) ) $.
